dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4701 IH: Protecting Americans from Fentanyl Trafficking Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. D'Esposito (for himself, Mr. Weber of Texas, and Mr. Gimenez) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To codify the temporary scheduling order for fentanyl-related substances by adding fentanyl-related substances to schedule I of the Controlled Substances Act.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting Americans from Fentanyl Trafficking Act of 2023.

section.header: Placement of fentanyl-related substances in schedule I
section.text: Schedule I of section 202(c) of the Controlled Substances Act (21 U.S.C. 812(c)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: Fentanyl-related substances, including their isomers, esters, ethers, salts, and salts of isomers, esters, and ethers.
For purposes of paragraph (1), the term fentanyl-related substance means any substance that—

subparagraph.text: is not listed in another schedule;
has not been approved under section 505 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 355) or granted an exemption for investigational use under subsection (i) of such section 505; and
is structurally related to fentanyl by—

clause.text: replacement of the phenyl portion of the phenethyl group by any monocycle, whether or not further substituted in or on the monocycle;
substitution in or on the phenethyl group with alkyl, alkenyl, alkoxyl, hydroxyl, halo, haloalkyl, amino, or nitro groups;
substitution in or on the piperidine ring with alkyl, alkenyl, alkoxyl, ester, ether, hydroxyl, halo, haloalkyl, amino, or nitro groups;
replacement of the aniline ring with any aromatic monocycle, whether or not further substituted in or on the aromatic monocycle; or
replacement of the N-propionyl group by another acyl group.
